body:
**If this issue affects you, please react with a üëç (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your feedback helps us prioritize which bugs to investigate and address first.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-10911)

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

body: Hey @OutOfRatRace! Thanks for filing the report. I was able to reproduce the issue, and it looks like an update to our emoji library may have not included the bucket emoji. I was able to put in the standard smiling emoji. Going to investigate more. If there's a small amount of missing emojis, we may keep the current integration and request to use a different emoji.

@kmcgrady , thank you for following up! Please keep me updated if y'all decide to add some of the emojis back in or not. I'll hold off on upgrading to the new version until I know I can keep using the bucket emoji for consistent "branding". ü™£

issue.title: Add marker that icon is an emoji for set page config

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Updates `set_page_config` to allow for newer emojis. We utilize the backend to determine if it's an emoji. We then parse it out on the frontend.

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

closes #10911

## Testing Plan

- Updated Unit Tests. Added JS test for all varieties of emojis (for future references).
- Updated E2E Tests to use a newer emoji

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

body: @OutOfRatRace We found a solution that should work, and I have a PR out with the changes. Should hopefully be merged soon.
@kmcgrady , that is wonderful - thank you so much for taking the time and energy to look into this and to get it resolved so quickly!
Hello @OutOfRatRace , we released Streamlit 1.44.1 which included a fix for this. Thanks again for reporting this issue!
@kmcgrady and @sfc-gh-bnisco , thank y'all so much for the quick turnaround on this!
